article_title: Lou Reed, a Life Well Beyond Velvet Underground
article_text:
Lou Reed embodied the underbelly of rock 'n' roll starting in the 1960s and for decades remained one of the genre's most influential figures. He died Sunday at age 71 of complications from a liver ailment, having undergone a transplant last May.

Mr. Reed was lead singer, songwriter and guitarist in the Velvet Underground, a seminal band whose spiky art rock was a counterpoint to flower-power attitudes. With songs such as...

He died Sunday at age 71 of complications from a liver ailment, having undergone a transplant last May.
